title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): Overcorrection
creator_contributor_role: Macomb Community College Instructional Television, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Behavior therapy
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Handicapped - Education
description: Episode number 7 of Series "Effective Behavioural Programming". Tape 7 : Overcorrection is a punishment procedure in which the misbehaving student is required to overcorrect the environmental effects of his misbehaviour (restitution) and to practice appropriate forms of behaviour in those situations where the misbehaviour commonly occurs (positive practice). NB. This videotape is on 525 line NTSC.
